lines.content: * Represents a simple task management application.
* It allows users to interact with tasks through a command-line interface.
* Constructs a new Jo object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path for storing task data.
* Runs the Jo application, displaying the welcome message and processing user commands.
* A custom exception class for handling exceptions specific to the `Jo` application.
* It extends the standard Java `Exception` class to provide custom error messages.
* Responsible for parsing user input and generating corresponding `Command` objects.
* It interprets user commands and creates the appropriate commands to perform tasks in the `Jo` application.
public Command perform(String input) throws JoException {

return new AddCommand(new Deadline(taskName, false, deadline));

return new AddCommand(new Event(taskName, false, start, end));

* Performs the parsing of the command based on the provided input.
* @param s The input string representing the command.
* @throws JoException If there is an error parsing the command.
public abstract Command perform(String s) throws JoException;
* Performs the parsing of the command based on the provided task index.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task associated with the command.
* Checks if a given input string is present in a specified enum class.
* @param input The input string to check.
* @param enumClass The enum class to check against.
* @return `true` if the input string is found in the enum class, otherwise `false`.
public static <E extends Enum<E>> boolean isInEnum(String input, Class<E> enumClass) {
* Parses the user input and generates the corresponding `Command` object.
* @return The `Command` object representing the parsed command.
* @throws JoException If there is an error parsing the command.
public static Command parse(String input) throws JoException {
throw new JoException("The command cannot be empty.");
throw new JoException(String.format("The description of a %s cannot be empty.", input));
throw new JoException(String.format("Please specify a valid task number to %s.", input));
throw new JoException("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Responsible for loading tasks from and updating tasks to a file.
* It provides methods to read tasks from a file and write tasks to a file.
* Constructs a new `Storage` object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The file path where task data is stored.
* Loads tasks from the specified file and returns them as an ArrayList.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file.
* @throws JoException If an error occurs while reading the file or parsing tasks.
* Updates the specified `TaskList` by writing its tasks to the file.
* @param taskList The `TaskList` to update in the file.
* @throws JoException If an error occurs while writing to the file.
public void update(TaskList taskList) throws JoException {
* Represents a list of tasks in the `Jo` application.
* It provides methods for managing tasks such as adding, deleting, marking, and searching.
* Constructs a new `TaskList` with the specified list of tasks.
* @param tasks The initial list of tasks to populate the `TaskList`.
* Deletes a task from the `TaskList` based on its index.
* @param index The index of the task to delete.
* Marks a task in the `TaskList` as done or undone based on its index.
* @param index  The index of the task to mark.
* @param isDone `true` to mark the task as done, `false` to mark it as undone.
public void markTask(int index, boolean isDone) {
* Searches for tasks with a specific deadline in the `TaskList`.
* @param deadline The deadline to search for.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks matching the specified deadline and are not marked as done.
* Searches for tasks in the task list that contain the specified keyword in their descriptions.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for within task descriptions.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks that match the search criteria (contain the keyword).
* Retrieves a task from the `TaskList` based on its index.
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Gets the number of tasks in the `TaskList`.
* @return The number of tasks in the `TaskList`.
* Responsible for handling user interactions and displaying messages in the `Jo` application.
* It provides methods for reading user input, showing welcome messages and displaying errors.
* Constructs a new `Ui` object with a `Scanner` for reading user input.
* Reads a command entered by the user.
* @return The user's input command as a string.
* Displays a welcome message when the application starts.
System.out.println("> Hello! I'm Jo.\n> What can I do for you?");
* Displays a farewell message when the application is about to exit.
System.out.println("> Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays an error message to the user.
* @param message The error message to display.
* Displays a message indicating the result of marking a task as done or undone.
* @param task   The task that was marked.
* @param isDone `true` if the task was marked as done, `false` if marked as undone.
public void markResult(Task task, boolean isDone) {
System.out.println("> Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("> OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays a message indicating the result of adding or removing a task from the list.
* @param task      The task that was added or removed.
* @param isAdd     `true` if a task was added, `false` if a task was removed.
public void modifyListResult(Task task, TaskList taskList, boolean isAdd) {
System.out.println("> Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("> Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.printf("> Now you have %d tasks in the list.%n", taskList.getSize());
* Displays a list of tasks that match a specified deadline date.
* @param deadline     The deadline date for which tasks are displayed.
* @param resultList   The list of tasks that match the deadline.
public void searchResult(LocalDate deadline, ArrayList<Task> resultList) {
System.out.println("> Here are the tasks that are due on "
System.out.println("\tYay, you have no task due on this day!");
* Displays the results of a task search to the user.
* @param resultList An ArrayList of tasks that match the search criteria.
System.out.println("> Here are the matching tasks in your list: ");
* Displays the list of tasks in the task list.
* @param taskList The task list to display.
System.out.println("> Here are the tasks in your list:");
* The `AddCommand` class represents a command for adding a task to the task list in the `Jo` application.
* Constructs an `AddCommand` object with the specified task to be added.
* @param task The task to be added to the task list.
* Executes the command, adding the task to the task list, updating storage, and displaying the result.
* @param tasks   The `TaskList` containing tasks to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage object for loading and saving tasks to a file.
* @throws JoException If an error occurs during the execution of the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoException {
* Checks whether the command results in exiting the application.
* @return `false` since adding a task does not exit the application.
* Retrieves the task associated with this `AddCommand`.
* @return The task to be added to the task list.
* The `CheckCommand` class represents a command for checking tasks with a specified deadline date.
* Constructs a `CheckCommand` object with the specified deadline date to be checked.
* @param deadline The deadline date for which tasks will be checked.
* Executes the command, searching for tasks with the specified deadline and displaying the result.
* @param tasks   The `TaskList` containing tasks to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage object for loading and saving tasks to a file.
* @throws JoException If an error occurs during the execution of the command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoException {
* Checks whether the command results in exiting the application.
* @return `false` since checking tasks by deadline does not exit the application.
* The `Command` class is an abstract base class for all command objects in the `Jo` application.
* Executes the command, performing specific actions on the task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param tasks   The `TaskList` containing tasks to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage object for loading and saving tasks to a file.
* @throws JoException If an error occurs during the execution of the command.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoException;
* Checks whether the command results in exiting the application.
* @return `true` if the command exits the application, `false` otherwise.
* The `DeleteCommand` class represents a command for deleting a task from the task list in the `Jo` application.
* Constructs a `DeleteCommand` object with the specified index of the task to be deleted.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted from the task list.
* Executes the command, deleting the specified task from the task list and updating storage.
* @param tasks   The `TaskList` containing tasks to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage object for loading and saving tasks to a file.
* @throws JoException If an error occurs during the execution of the command, such as an invalid index.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoException {
throw new JoException("This task does not exist.");
* Checks whether the command results in exiting the application.
* @return `false` since deleting a task does not exit the application.
* The `ExitCommand` class represents a command for exiting the `Jo` application.
* Executes the command, triggering the application to exit and displaying a farewell message.
* @param tasks   The `TaskList` containing tasks to operate on (unused in this command).
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages and handling the exit.
* @param storage The storage object for loading and saving tasks to a file (unused in this command).
* @throws JoException If an error occurs during the execution of the command (unused in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoException {
* Checks whether the command results in exiting the application.
* @return `true` since this command exits the application.
* The `ListCommand` class represents a command for listing tasks in the `Jo` application.
* Executes the command, displaying the list of tasks to the user.
* @param tasks   The `TaskList` containing tasks to be listed.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying the list.
* @param storage The storage object for loading and saving tasks to a file (unused in this command).
* @throws JoException If an error occurs during the execution of the command (unused in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoException {
* Checks whether the command results in exiting the application.
* @return `false` since listing tasks does not exit the application.
* The `MarkCommand` class represents a command for marking or unmarking a task in the `Jo` application.

* @param index  The index of the task to be marked or unmarked.
* @param isDone `true` if the task should be marked as done, `false` if it should be marked as undone.

* @param tasks   The `TaskList` containing tasks to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage object for loading and saving tasks to a file.
* @throws JoException If an error occurs during the execution of the command, such as an invalid index.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JoException {
throw new JoException("This task does not exist.");
* Checks whether the command results in exiting the application.
* @return `false` since marking or unmarking a task does not exit the application.
* The `SearchCommand` class represents a command for searching tasks containing a specified keyword.
* Constructs a `SearchCommand` object with the specified keyword to be used for task search.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for within task descriptions.

* @return `false` since searching for tasks does not exit the application.
* Represents a deadline task in the `Jo` application.
* It includes properties such as a description and a deadline date.
* Constructs a new `Deadline` object with the specified description, completion status, and deadline date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param isDone      `true` if the deadline task is marked as done, `false` if it is undone.
* @param deadline    The deadline date of the task.
public Deadline(String description, boolean isDone, LocalDate deadline) {
* Returns a formatted string representation of the deadline task.
* @return A string in the format: "[D][Status] Description (by: DeadlineDate)".
* Converts the deadline task to a string format suitable for storing in a file.
* @return A string in the format: "D | Status | Description | DeadlineDate".
* Retrieves the deadline date of the deadline task.
* @return The deadline date of the task.
* Represents an event task in the `Jo` application.
* It includes properties such as a description, start date, and end date.
* Constructs a new `Event` object with the specified description, completion status, start date, and end date.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param isDone      `true` if the event task is marked as done, `false` if it is undone.
* @param start       The start date of the event.
* @param end         The end date of the event.
public Event(String description, boolean isDone, LocalDate start, LocalDate end) {
* Returns a formatted string representation of the event task.
* @return A string in the format: "[E][Status] Description (from: StartDate to: EndDate)".
* Converts the event task to a string format suitable for storing in a file.
* @return A string in the format: "E | Status | Description | StartDate | EndDate".
* Retrieves the end date of the event task.
* @return The end date of the event.
* Represents a generic task in the `Jo` application.
* It includes properties such as a description and completion status.
* Constructs a new `Task` object with the specified description and completion status.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param isDone      `true` if the task is marked as done, `false` if it is undone.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* @return The status icon ("X" if the task is done, " " if it is undone).
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns a formatted string representation of the task.

* Marks the task as done or undone.

* Converts the task to a string format suitable for storing in a file.
* @return A string in the format: "T | Status | Description".
* Retrieves the description of the task.
